text: The most ancient Russian city of Smolensk, turned into ruins by the Germans. Destroyed power plant. Exploded water pump tower. Destroyed tram park. The building in which the city institutions were located. There was a Lino-Combinat named after Andreev. The Germans took machines, boilers, rails and other equipment to Germany and destroyed the Combinat. The destroyed building of the clinical hospital, which was located in 20 buildings, was blown up by the Germans and burned down the building of the medical institutions of Smolensk. The buildings of the secondary school were destroyed in the same way as the buildings of the other 21 schools of Smolensk. There were children's basements here. These are the ruins of the Pioneers' Palace. The embankment streets were destroyed by the Germans. Dzerzhinsky Street, the main street of the city, has been blown up and burned down. Before retreating, the Germans mined the buildings of the city. Some houses managed to be saved. The sappers extract and neutralize the mines and bombs laid by the Germans and have not yet exploded. From 8,000 houses in Smolensk, 7,300 houses were destroyed by the Germans. Bryansk. An ancient city, for the first time mentioned in the chronicles in 1146. Exploded and destroyed by the Germans. The destroyed House of Councils. The building in which the railway hospital was located. Destroyed industrial enterprises. The city of Kursk is one of the oldest Russian cities that existed since the 11th century as a large regional cultural center. The Germans caused enormous destruction in Kursk. Orel, a city that has existed since 1564, a city with a large number of educational institutions and economic enterprises, burned down and burned down by the retreating Germans. The ruins of the buildings in which the city institutions were placed. These are the destroyed residential buildings. Thousands of Orla residents have lost their lives. This is Novgorod, the oldest Russian city. It was built in the 9th century. Before the war, Novgorod was a large scientific and cultural center. In it, historical monuments of Russian art and culture have been preserved. The Germans burned and destroyed the city. Of the 2,346 residential buildings, only 40 have been preserved in Novgorod. The city of Solzhenitsyn. The Germans destroyed not only large administrative centers, but also small cities. The city of Vyazma, the city of Gzhatsk, the city of Vishnevets, The city of Yuhnov, the city of Epifany, the city of Holm, The city of the bottom, the city of the old Rus, the city of the great meadows. Who's this to tell me? I want to go first, but I have to go with him.
